text:
<@U04MXV1TG4R> not really, I think it is still true that webhooks are only supported by Public Apps.
I ended up writing my own Public App and then did not release it. It's slightly more effort but works ok for my purpose.
I see! That make sense. I will try that too. Thank you for the help! :slightly_smiling_face:
Hiya, Any of you ever included AR functionalities on a site? any recommendations of a library to use :smile:

I made this VR compatible page on CMS Free. <https://jmclaren-22032658.HubSpotpagebuilder.com/experience>

Library I used was a-frame.
<https://aframe.io/>

Aframe supports AR, and because you’re working with web components it feels familiar for folks comfortable with HTML.

Hey Guys!

I've created a private app and attached the webhook to a system called Yardi, although I provided all the permissions to the webhook on HS and allowed a 2 way sync on yardi it still doesn't pull any data, any thoughts?

Has anyone ever built an external platform to create Landing-Pages. The creation of the Landing-Pages would happen over the API and in a Custom Module are the Landing-Pages shown, almost like deals? I built it in my head, I’m just curious if someone ever did something like that before.
im kind of confused, what are you trying to do?
just rediscovered this :laughing:

Does anyone have any out of the box ideas for this? Basically I want to require a file when a deal does into the closed won stage. You can create a file field and set it as a required stage property but from the UI it's obviously not a file selector instead it's just a text property.

What about if you have a little note there that tells you to do that on the deal it self and as long as that file is not in the deal itself the card always gets pushed back to another stage until you did it.
But you still can't add a file from the deal itself (to this field), you could only add the file through a note and have it appear in the attachments view
Upload it to the Attachements it self, but there you can can many more documents and then how you make sure it the one you need.
sorry I think I'm misunderstanding something
Yep, but how would I get those files into the file field
I know what you mean.
it's a little tricky, right?
I’m thinking of a workound, but they are all little dirty :slightly_smiling_face:
besides using a workflow that reuploads the file to the manager, and then you copy the link over to the field

a really wild and dirty one would be a custom card with an upload button what opens you a page where you have to upload that specific document and only if that document is given you can move the deal card to the next stage

My idea is wild… you’re having this form and depend on the checkboxes you click it generates you a landing page. I know it’s possible and I also know how to do it. It’s more to share ideas if someone did something like that before.

That is an interesting one, was thinking about using a link in that field that would take the person to a deal form (with the recordid populated in the url), and have the file field be the only field on the form can you upload the file from there (the state would update in a hidden field) but you can't build out deal forms (just found this out)

another dirty one. at the moment the card gets moved you send an email with a page to to upload. if he does do that, the card gets moved, if not the card will not move and that email will be sent to him until he does it.

haha, that one is pretty dirty but the issue is that you would have to connect that page to the api directly, and you would still need to upload the file to the file manager seperately (which would be a pain)
Love the ideas Thomas
Thanks for thinking through things with me
:slightly_smiling_face:
